alert.note: Alert for Clark; Garland; Hot Spring (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 8:25AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Clark, eastern Garland and central Hot Spring Counties through 900 AM CDT... At 825 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near DeGray Lake State Park, or 15 miles southwest of Hot Springs, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hot Springs... Hot Springs Village... Malvern... Rockport... Hot Springs Memorial Field... Lofton... Rockwell... DeGray Lake State Park... Hot Springs National Park... Bismarck... Magnet Cove... Red Oak... Oaklawn Racetrack... Sunshine... Mountain Valley... De Roche... Point Cedar... Lake Catherine State Park... Gulpha Gorge... Pettyview... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for central Arkansas.
